REPEL.name: Repel
REPEL.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 150 steps after its use.

SUPERREPEL.name: Super Repel
SUPERREPEL.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 250 steps after its use.

MAXREPEL.name: Max Repel
MAXREPEL.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 850 steps after its use.

INFINITEREPELTOGGLE.name: Infinite Repel
INFINITEREPELTOGGLE.description: When activated, all wild encounters are turned off.

BLACKFLUTE.name: Black Flute
BLACKFLUTE.description: A black flute made from blown glass. Its melody makes wild Pokémon less likely to appear.

WHITEFLUTE.name: White Flute
WHITEFLUTE.description: A white flute made from blown glass. Its melody makes wild Pokémon more likely to appear.

HONEY.name: Honey
HONEY.description: A sweet honey with a lush aroma that attracts wild Pokémon when used in tall grass, in caves, or elsewhere.

REDSHARD.name: Red Shard
REDSHARD.description: A small red shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

YELLOWSHARD.name: Yellow Shard
YELLOWSHARD.description: A small yellow shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

BLUESHARD.name: Blue Shard
BLUESHARD.description: A small blue shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

GREENSHARD.name: Green Shard
GREENSHARD.description: A small green shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

FIRESTONE.name: Fire Stone
FIRESTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It is colored orange.

THUNDERSTONE.name: Thunder Stone
THUNDERSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It has a thunderbolt pattern.

WATERSTONE.name: Water Stone
WATERSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It is a clear, light blue.

LEAFSTONE.name: Leaf Stone
LEAFSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It has a leaf pattern.

MOONSTONE.name: Moon Stone
MOONSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It is as black as the night sky.

SUNSTONE.name: Sun Stone
SUNSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It is as red as the sun.

DUSKSTONE.name: Dusk Stone
DUSKSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It is as dark as dark can be.

DAWNSTONE.name: Dawn Stone
DAWNSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It sparkles like eyes.

SHINYSTONE.name: Shiny Stone
SHINYSTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It shines with a dazzling light.

ICESTONE.name: Ice Stone
ICESTONE.description: A stone used for Pokemon evolution. It has a snowflake pattern.

SWEETAPPLE.name: Sweet Apple
SWEETAPPLE.description: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's exceptionally sweet.

TARTAPPLE.name: Tart Apple
TARTAPPLE.description: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's exceptionally tart.

CRACKEDPOT.name: Cracked Pot
CRACKEDPOT.description: A peculiar cracked teapot that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It makes delicious tea.

CHIPPEDPOT.name: Chipped Pot
CHIPPEDPOT.description: A peculiar chipped teapot that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It makes delicious tea.

GALARICACUFF.name: Galarica Cuff
GALARICACUFF.description: A cuff made from woven-together Galarica Twigs. Giving it to a Galarian Slowpoke would make it very happy.

GALARICAWREATH.name: Galarica Wreath
GALARICAWREATH.description: A wreath made from woven-together Galarica Twigs. A Galarian Slowpoke wearing this would be very happy.

REDAPRICORN.name: Red Apricorn
REDAPRICORN.description: A red Apricorn. It assails your nostrils.

YELLOWAPRICORN.name: Yellow Apricorn
YELLOWAPRICORN.description: A yellow Apricorn. It has an invigorating scent.

BLUEAPRICORN.name: Blue Apricorn
BLUEAPRICORN.description: A blue Apricorn. It smells a bit like grass.

GREENAPRICORN.name: Green Apricorn
GREENAPRICORN.description: A green Apricorn. It has a mysterious, aromatic scent.

PINKAPRICORN.name: Pink Apricorn
PINKAPRICORN.description: A pink Apricorn. It has a nice, sweet scent.

WHITEAPRICORN.name: White Apricorn
WHITEAPRICORN.description: A white Apricorn. It doesn't smell like anything.

BLACKAPRICORN.name: Black Apricorn
BLACKAPRICORN.description: A black Apricorn. It has an indescribable scent.

HELIXFOSSIL.name: Helix Fossil
HELIXFOSSIL.description: A fossil of a pokemon with a magical hat.

DOMEFOSSIL.name: Dome Fossil
DOMEFOSSIL.description: A fossil of a Pokemon that lived in prehistoric jungles.

OLDAMBER.name: Old Amber
OLDAMBER.description: A piece of amber that contains the genes of an ancient Pokémon. It is clear with a reddish tint.

ROOTFOSSIL.name: Root Fossil
ROOTFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived atop mountains.

CLAWFOSSIL.name: Claw Fossil
CLAWFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived in the desert.

SKULLFOSSIL.name: Skull Fossil
SKULLFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that lived on the land. It appears to be part of a head.

ARMORFOSSIL.name: Armor Fossil
ARMORFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that lived in icy caves.

COVERFOSSIL.name: Cover Fossil
COVERFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived on land.

PLUMEFOSSIL.name: Plume Fossil
PLUMEFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that flew in the sky in ancient times.

JAWFOSSIL.name: Jaw Fossil
JAWFOSSIL.description: A fossil that is somehow both hot and cold to the touch.

SAILFOSSIL.name: Sail Fossil
SAILFOSSIL.description: A fossil that exudes a pleasant aroma and glows in the sunlight.

FOSSILIZEDBIRD.name: Fossilized Bird
FOSSILIZEDBIRD.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once soared through the sky. What it looked like is a mystery.

FOSSILIZEDFISH.name: Fossilized Fish
FOSSILIZEDFISH.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once lived in the sea. What it looked like is a mystery.

FOSSILIZEDDRAKE.name: Fossilized Drake
FOSSILIZEDDRAKE.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once roamed the land. What it looked like is a mystery.

FOSSILIZEDDINO.name: Fossilized Dino
FOSSILIZEDDINO.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once lived in the sea. What it looked like is a mystery.

PRETTYFEATHER.name: Pretty Feather
PRETTYFEATHER.description: Though this feather is beautiful, it's just a regular feather and has no effect on Pokémon.

TINYMUSHROOM.name: Tiny Mushroom
TINYMUSHROOM.description: A small and rare mushroom. It is sought after by collectors.

BIGMUSHROOM.name: Big Mushroom
BIGMUSHROOM.description: A large and rare mushroom. It is sought after by collectors.

BALMMUSHROOM.name: Balm Mushroom
BALMMUSHROOM.description: A rare mushroom which gives off a nice fragrance. It is sought after by collectors.

PEARL.name: Pearl
PEARL.description: A somewhat-small pearl that sparkles in a pretty silver color. It can be sold cheaply to shops.

BIGPEARL.name: Big Pearl
BIGPEARL.description: A quite-large pearl that sparkles in a pretty silver color. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

PEARLSTRING.name: Pearl String
PEARLSTRING.description: Very large pearls that sparkle in a pretty silver color. A maniac will buy them for a high price.

STARDUST.name: Stardust
STARDUST.description: Lovely, red-colored sand with a loose, silky feel. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

STARPIECE.name: Star Piece
STARPIECE.description: A shard of a pretty gem that sparkles in a red color. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

COMETSHARD.name: Comet Shard
COMETSHARD.description: A shard which fell to the ground when a comet approached. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

NUGGET.name: Nugget
NUGGET.description: A nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

BIGNUGGET.name: Big Nugget
BIGNUGGET.description: A big nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

HEARTSCALE.name: Heart Scale
HEARTSCALE.description: A pretty, heart-shaped scale that is extremely rare. It glows faintly in the colors of the rainbow.

SLOWPOKETAIL.name: Slowpoke Tail
SLOWPOKETAIL.description: A very tasty tail of something. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

RAREBONE.name: Rare Bone
RAREBONE.description: A bone that is extremely valuable for Pokémon archaeology. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICCOPPER.name: Relic Copper
RELICCOPPER.description: A copper coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICSILVER.name: Relic Silver
RELICSILVER.description: A silver coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICGOLD.name: Relic Gold
RELICGOLD.description: A gold coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICVASE.name: Relic Vase
RELICVASE.description: A vase made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICBAND.name: Relic Band
RELICBAND.description: A bracelet made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICSTATUE.name: Relic Statue
RELICSTATUE.description: A stone figure made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICCROWN.name: Relic Crown
RELICCROWN.description: A crown made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

GROWTHMULCH.name: Growth Mulch
GROWTHMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

DAMPMULCH.name: Damp Mulch
DAMPMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

STABLEMULCH.name: Stable Mulch
STABLEMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

GOOEYMULCH.name: Gooey Mulch
GOOEYMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

SHOALSALT.name: Shoal Salt
SHOALSALT.description: Pure salt that can be discovered deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

SHOALSHELL.name: Shoal Shell
SHOALSHELL.description: A pretty seashell that can be found deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

ODDKEYSTONE.name: Odd Keystone
ODDKEYSTONE.description: A vital item that is needed to keep a stone tower from collapsing. Voices can be heard from it occasionally.

REDNECTAR.name: Red Nectar
REDNECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained at Ula'ula Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

YELLOWNECTAR.name: Yellow Nectar
YELLOWNECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained at Melemele Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

PINKNECTAR.name: Pink Nectar
PINKNECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained from shrubs on Royal Avenue. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

PURPLENECTAR.name: Purple Nectar
PURPLENECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained at Poni Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

CDTRANCE.name: Trance CD
CDTRANCE.description: A CD that has some Trance music. It changes the form of Oricorio.

CDMETAL.name: Metal CD
CDMETAL.description: A CD that has some Metal music. It changes the form of Oricorio.

CDRAVE.name: Rave CD
CDRAVE.description: A CD that has some Electronic music. It changes the form of Oricorio.

CDWORLD.name: World CD
CDWORLD.description: A CD that has some Latin music. It changes the form of Oricorio.

AIRBALLOON.name: Air Balloon
AIRBALLOON.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder will float in the air until hit. Once hit, this item will burst.

BRIGHTPOWDER.name: Bright Powder
BRIGHTPOWDER.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It casts a tricky glare that lowers the opponent's accuracy.

EVIOLITE.name: Eviolite
EVIOLITE.description: A mysterious evolutionary lump. When held, it raises the Defense and Sp. Def if the holder can still evolve.

FLOATSTONE.name: Float Stone
FLOATSTONE.description: A very light stone. It reduces the weight of a Pokémon when held.

DESTINYKNOT.name: Destiny Knot
DESTINYKNOT.description: A long, thin, bright-red string to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder becomes infatuated, so does the foe.

ROCKYHELMET.name: Rocky Helmet
ROCKYHELMET.description: If the holder of this item takes damage, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact.

ASSAULTVEST.name: Assault Vest
ASSAULTVEST.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This offensive vest raises Sp. Def but prevents the use of status moves.

SAFETYGOGGLES.name: Safety Goggles
SAFETYGOGGLES.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. They protect the holder from weather-related damage and powder.

PROTECTIVEPADS.name: Protective Pads
PROTECTIVEPADS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. They protect the holder from effects caused by making contact.

HEAVYDUTYBOOTS.name: Heavy-Duty Boots
HEAVYDUTYBOOTS.description: These boots prevent the effects of traps set on the battlefield.

UTILITYUMBRELLA.name: Utility Umbrella
UTILITYUMBRELLA.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sturdy umbrella protects the holder from the effects of rain and sun.

EJECTBUTTON.name: Eject Button
EJECTBUTTON.description: If the holder is hit by an attack, it will switch with another Pokémon in your party.

EJECTPACK.name: Eject Pack
EJECTPACK.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder's stats are lowered, it will be switched out of battle.

REDCARD.name: Red Card
REDCARD.description: A card with a mysterious power. When the holder is struck by a foe, the attacker is removed from battle.

SHEDSHELL.name: Shed Shell
SHEDSHELL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This discarded carapace lets the holder switch out of battle without fail.

SMOKEBALL.name: Smoke Ball
SMOKEBALL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokémon without fail.

LUCKYEGG.name: Lucky Egg
LUCKYEGG.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is an egg filled with happiness that earns extra Exp. Points in battle.

EXPSHARE.name: Exp. Share
EXPSHARE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder gets a share of a battle's Exp. Points without battling.

AMULETCOIN.name: Amulet Coin
AMULETCOIN.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles a battle's prize money if the holding Pokémon joins in.

SOOTHEBELL.name: Soothe Bell
SOOTHEBELL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The comforting chime of this bell calms the holder, making it friendly.

CLEANSETAG.name: Cleanse Tag
CLEANSETAG.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the first one in the party.

CHOICEBAND.name: Choice Band
CHOICEBAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This headband ups Attack, but allows the use of only one move.

CHOICESPECS.name: Choice Specs
CHOICESPECS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These curious glasses boost Sp. Atk but allows the use of only one move.

CHOICESCARF.name: Choice Scarf
CHOICESCARF.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This scarf boosts Speed but allows the use of only one move.

HEATROCK.name: Heat Rock
HEATROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Sunny Day used by the holder.

DAMPROCK.name: Damp Rock
DAMPROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Rain Dance used by the holder.

SMOOTHROCK.name: Smooth Rock
SMOOTHROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Sandstorm used by the holder.

ICYROCK.name: Icy Rock
ICYROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Hail used by the holder.

TERRAINEXTENDER.name: Terrain Extender
TERRAINEXTENDER.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the terrain caused by the holder.

LIGHTCLAY.name: Light Clay
LIGHTCLAY.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Protective moves like Light Screen and Reflect will be effective longer.

GRIPCLAW.name: Grip Claw
GRIPCLAW.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of multiturn attacks like Bind and Wrap.

BINDINGBAND.name: Binding Band
BINDINGBAND.description: A band that increases the power of binding moves when held.

BIGROOT.name: Big Root
BIGROOT.description: A Pokémon held item that boosts the power of HP-stealing moves to let the holder recover more HP.

BLACKSLUDGE.name: Black Sludge
BLACKSLUDGE.description: A held item that gradually restores the HP of Poison-type Pokémon. It inflicts damage on all other types.

LEFTOVERS.name: Leftovers
LEFTOVERS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is gradually restored during battle.

SHELLBELL.name: Shell Bell
SHELLBELL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is restored a little every time it inflicts damage.

MENTALHERB.name: Mental Herb
MENTALHERB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It snaps the holder out of infatuation. It can be used only once.

WHITEHERB.name: White Herb
WHITEHERB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It restores any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

POWERHERB.name: Power Herb
POWERHERB.description: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon. It allows the immediate use of a move that charges up first.

ABSORBBULB.name: Absorb Bulb
ABSORBBULB.description: A consumable bulb. If the holder is hit by a Water-type move, its Sp. Atk will rise.

CELLBATTERY.name: Cell Battery
CELLBATTERY.description: A consumable battery. If the holder is hit by an Electric-type move, its Attack will rise.

LUMINOUSMOSS.name: Luminous Moss
LUMINOUSMOSS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def if hit by a Water-type attack. It can only be used once.

SNOWBALL.name: Snowball
SNOWBALL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack if hit by an Ice-type attack. It can only be used once.

WEAKNESSPOLICY.name: Weakness Policy
WEAKNESSPOLICY.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's Attack and Sp. Atk sharply increase if hit by a move it's weak to.

BLUNDERPOLICY.name: Blunder Policy
BLUNDERPOLICY.description: Raises Speed sharply when a Pokémon misses with a move because of accuracy.

THROATSPRAY.name: Throat Spray
THROATSPRAY.description: Raises Sp. Atk when a Pokémon uses a sound-based move.

ADRENALINEORB.name: Adrenaline Orb
ADRENALINEORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Speed when intimidated. It can be used only once.

ROOMSERVICE.name: Room Service
ROOMSERVICE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Lowers Speed when Trick Room takes effect.

ELECTRICSEED.name: Electric Seed
ELECTRICSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Electric Terrain. It can only be used once.

GRASSYSEED.name: Grassy Seed
GRASSYSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Grassy Terrain. It can only be used once.

MISTYSEED.name: Misty Seed
MISTYSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Misty Terrain. It can only be used once.

PSYCHICSEED.name: Psychic Seed
PSYCHICSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Psychic Terrain. It can only be used once.

LIFEORB.name: Life Orb
LIFEORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the power of moves, but at the cost of some HP on each hit.

EXPERTBELT.name: Expert Belt
EXPERTBELT.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a well-worn belt that slightly boosts the power of supereffective moves.

METRONOME.name: Metronome
METRONOME.description: A Pokémon held item that boosts a move used consecutively. Its effect is reset if another move is used.

MUSCLEBAND.name: Muscle Band
MUSCLEBAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a headband that slightly boosts the power of physical moves.

WISEGLASSES.name: Wise Glasses
WISEGLASSES.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a thick pair of glasses that slightly boosts the power of special moves.

RAZORCLAW.name: Razor Claw
RAZORCLAW.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a sharply hooked claw that ups the holder's critical-hit ratio.

SCOPELENS.name: Scope Lens
SCOPELENS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a lens that boosts the holder's critical-hit ratio.

WIDELENS.name: Wide Lens
WIDELENS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a magnifying lens that slightly boosts the accuracy of moves.

ZOOMLENS.name: Zoom Lens
ZOOMLENS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder moves after its target, its accuracy will be boosted.

KINGSROCK.name: King's Rock
KINGSROCK.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder inflicts damage, the target may flinch.

RAZORFANG.name: Razor Fang
RAZORFANG.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It may make foes and allies flinch when the holder inflicts damage.

LAGGINGTAIL.name: Lagging Tail
LAGGINGTAIL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is tremendously heavy and makes the holder move slower than usual.

QUICKCLAW.name: Quick Claw
QUICKCLAW.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A light, sharp claw that lets the bearer move first occasionally.

FOCUSBAND.name: Focus Band
FOCUSBAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder may endure a potential KO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.

FOCUSSASH.name: Focus Sash
FOCUSSASH.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If it has full HP, the holder will endure one potential KO attack, leaving 1 HP.

FLAMEORB.name: Flame Orb
FLAMEORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bizarre orb that inflicts a burn on the holder in battle.

TOXICORB.name: Toxic Orb
TOXICORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bizarre orb that badly poisons the holder in battle.

STICKYBARB.name: Sticky Barb
STICKYBARB.description: A held item that damages the holder on every turn. It may latch on to Pokémon that touch the holder.

IRONBALL.name: Iron Ball
IRONBALL.description: A Pokémon held item that cuts Speed. It makes Flying-type and levitating holders susceptible to Ground moves.

RINGTARGET.name: Ring Target
RINGTARGET.description: Moves that would otherwise have no effect will land on the Pokémon that holds it.

MACHOBRACE.name: Macho Brace
MACHOBRACE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a stiff, heavy brace that promotes strong growth but lowers Speed.

POWERWEIGHT.name: Power Weight
POWERWEIGHT.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes HP gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERBRACER.name: Power Bracer
POWERBRACER.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Attack gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERBELT.name: Power Belt
POWERBELT.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Defense gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERLENS.name: Power Lens
POWERLENS.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Atk gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERBAND.name: Power Band
POWERBAND.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Def gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERANKLET.name: Power Anklet
POWERANKLET.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Speed gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

LAXINCENSE.name: Lax Incense
LAXINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The tricky aroma of this incense may make attacks miss the holder.

FULLINCENSE.name: Full Incense
FULLINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense makes the holder bloated and slow moving.

LUCKINCENSE.name: Luck Incense
LUCKINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles a battle's prize money if the holding Pokémon joins in.

PUREINCENSE.name: Pure Incense
PUREINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the first one in the party.

SEAINCENSE.name: Sea Incense
SEAINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It has a curious aroma that boosts the power of Water-type moves.

WAVEINCENSE.name: Wave Incense
WAVEINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It has a curious aroma that boosts the power of Water-type moves.

ROSEINCENSE.name: Rose Incense
ROSEINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Grass-type moves.

ODDINCENSE.name: Odd Incense
ODDINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Psychic-type moves.

ROCKINCENSE.name: Rock Incense
ROCKINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Rock-type moves.

CHARCOAL.name: Charcoal
CHARCOAL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a combustible fuel that boosts the power of Fire-type moves.

MYSTICWATER.name: Mystic Water
MYSTICWATER.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a teardrop-shaped gem that ups the power of Water-type moves.

MAGNET.name: Magnet
MAGNET.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a powerful magnet that boosts the power of Electric-type moves.

MIRACLESEED.name: Miracle Seed
MIRACLESEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a seed imbued with life that ups the power of Grass-type moves.

NEVERMELTICE.name: Never-Melt Ice
NEVERMELTICE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a piece of ice that repels heat and boosts Ice-type moves.

BLACKBELT.name: Black Belt
BLACKBELT.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a belt that boosts determination and Fighting-type moves.

POISONBARB.name: Poison Barb
POISONBARB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a small, poisonous barb that ups the power of Poison-type moves.

SOFTSAND.name: Soft Sand
SOFTSAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a loose, silky sand that boosts the power of Ground-type moves.

SHARPBEAK.name: Sharp Beak
SHARPBEAK.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a long, sharp beak that boosts the power of Flying-type moves.

TWISTEDSPOON.name: Twisted Spoon
TWISTEDSPOON.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a spoon imbued with telekinetic power that boosts Psychic-type moves.

SILVERPOWDER.name: Silver Powder
SILVERPOWDER.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a shiny, silver powder that ups the power of Bug-type moves.

HARDSTONE.name: Hard Stone

MAXHONEY.description: Honey that Dynamax Vespiquen produces. It has the same effect as a Max Revive.

ETHER.name: Ether
ETHER.description: It restores the PP of a Pokémon's selected move by a maximum of 10 points.

MAXETHER.name: Max Ether
MAXETHER.description: It fully restores the PP of a single selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

ELIXIR.name: Elixir
ELIXIR.description: It restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokémon by 10 points each.

MAXELIXIR.name: Max Elixir
MAXELIXIR.description: It fully restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokémon.

PPUP.name: PP Up
PPUP.description: It slightly raises the maximum PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

PPMAX.name: PP Max
PPMAX.description: It maximally raises the top PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

HPUP.name: HP Up
HPUP.description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the HP IV of a single Pokémon.

PROTEIN.name: Protein
PROTEIN.description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the Attack IV of a single Pokémon.

IRON.name: Iron
IRON.description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the Defense IV of a single Pokémon.

CALCIUM.name: Calcium
CALCIUM.description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the Sp. Atk IV of a single Pokémon.

ZINC.name: Zinc
ZINC.description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the Sp. Def IV of a single Pokémon.

CARBOS.name: Carbos
CARBOS.description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the Speed IV of a single Pokémon.

HEALTHFEATHER.name: Health Feather
HEALTHFEATHER.description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It lowers the HP IV of a single Pokémon.

MUSCLEFEATHER.name: Muscle Feather
MUSCLEFEATHER.description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It lowers the Attack IV of a single Pokémon.

RESISTFEATHER.name: Resist Feather
RESISTFEATHER.description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It lowers the Defense IV of a single Pokémon.

GENIUSFEATHER.name: Genius Feather
GENIUSFEATHER.description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It lowers the base Sp. Atk IV of a single Pokémon.

CLEVERFEATHER.name: Clever Feather
CLEVERFEATHER.description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It lowers the base Sp. Def IV of a single Pokémon.

SWIFTFEATHER.name: Swift Feather
SWIFTFEATHER.description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It lowers the base Speed IV of a single Pokémon.

LONELYMINT.name: Lonely Mint
LONELYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

ADAMANTMINT.name: Adamant Mint
ADAMANTMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

NAUGHTYMINT.name: Naughty Mint
NAUGHTYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

BRAVEMINT.name: Brave Mint
BRAVEMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

BOLDMINT.name: Bold Mint
BOLDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

IMPISHMINT.name: Impish Mint
IMPISHMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

LAXMINT.name: Lax Mint
LAXMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

RELAXEDMINT.name: Relaxed Mint
RELAXEDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

MODESTMINT.name: Modest Mint
MODESTMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

MILDMINT.name: Mild Mint
MILDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

RASHMINT.name: Rash Mint
RASHMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

QUIETMINT.name: Quiet Mint
QUIETMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

CALMMINT.name: Calm Mint
CALMMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

GENTLEMINT.name: Gentle Mint
GENTLEMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

CAREFULMINT.name: Careful Mint
CAREFULMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

SASSYMINT.name: Sassy Mint
SASSYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

TIMIDMINT.name: Timid Mint
TIMIDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

HASTYMINT.name: Hasty Mint
HASTYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

JOLLYMINT.name: Jolly Mint
JOLLYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

NAIVEMINT.name: Naive Mint
NAIVEMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

SERIOUSMINT.name: Serious Mint
SERIOUSMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, all of its stats will grow at an equal rate.

ABILITYCAPSULE.name: Ability Capsule
ABILITYCAPSULE.description: A capsule that allows a Pokémon with two Abilities to switch between these Abilities when it is used.

ABILITYPATCH.name: Ability Patch
ABILITYPATCH.description: A patch that allows a Pokémon with a regular Ability to have a rare Ability.

EXPCANDYXS.name: Exp. Candy XS
EXPCANDYXS.description: A candy packed with energy. When consumed, it will grant a Pokémon a very small amount of Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYS.name: Exp. Candy S
EXPCANDYS.description: A candy packed with energy. When consumed, it will grant a Pokémon a small amount of Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYM.name: Exp. Candy M
EXPCANDYM.description: A candy packed with energy. When consumed, it will grant a Pokémon a moderate amount of Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYL.name: Exp. Candy L
EXPCANDYL.description: A candy packed with energy. When consumed, it will grant a Pokémon a large amount of Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYXL.name: Exp. Candy XL
EXPCANDYXL.description: A candy packed with energy. When consumed, it will grant a Pokémon a very large amount of Exp. Points.

RARECANDY.name: Rare Candy
RARECANDY.description: A candy that is packed with energy. It raises the level of a single Pokémon by one.

MASTERBALL.name: Temporal Ball
MASTERBALL.description: The best Ball with the ultimate level of performance. It will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.

ULTRABALL.name: Ultra Ball
ULTRABALL.description: An ultra-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a Super Ball.

GREATBALL.name: Great Ball
GREATBALL.description: A good, high-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a standard Poké Ball.

POKEBALL.name: Poké Ball
POKEBALL.description: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It is thrown like a ball at the target. It is designed as a capsule system.

SAFARIBALL.name: Safari Ball
SAFARIBALL.description: A special Poké Ball that is used only in the Safari Zone. It is decorated in a camouflage pattern.

SPORTBALL.name: Sport Ball
SPORTBALL.description: A special Poké Ball for the Bug-Catching Contest.

NETBALL.name: Net Ball
NETBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Water- and Bug-type Pokémon.

DIVEBALL.name: Dive Ball
DIVEBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon that live underwater.

NESTBALL.name: Nest Ball
NESTBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on weaker Pokémon in the wild.

REPEATBALL.name: Repeat Ball
REPEATBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon species that were previously caught.

TIMERBALL.name: Timer Ball
TIMERBALL.description: A somewhat different Ball that becomes progressively better the more turns there are in a battle.

LUXURYBALL.name: Luxury Ball
LUXURYBALL.description: A comfortable Poké Ball that makes a caught wild Pokémon quickly grow friendly.

PREMIERBALL.name: Premier Ball
PREMIERBALL.description: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that has been specially made to commemorate an event of some sort.

DUSKBALL.name: Dusk Ball
DUSKBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places like caves.

HEALBALL.name: Heal Ball
HEALBALL.description: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the caught Pokémon's HP and eliminates any status problem.

QUICKBALL.name: Quick Ball
QUICKBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that provides a better catch rate if used at the start of a wild encounter.

CHERISHBALL.name: Cherish Ball
CHERISHBALL.description: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been specially crafted to commemorate an occasion of some sort.

FASTBALL.name: Fast Ball
FASTBALL.description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch fast Pokémon.

LEVELBALL.name: Level Ball
LEVELBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are a lower level than your own.

LUREBALL.name: Lure Ball
LUREBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon hooked by a Rod when fishing.

HEAVYBALL.name: Heavy Ball
HEAVYBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching very heavy Pokémon.

LOVEBALL.name: Love Ball
LOVEBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are the opposite gender of your Pokémon.

FRIENDBALL.name: Friend Ball
FRIENDBALL.description: A Poké Ball that makes caught Pokémon more friendly.

MOONBALL.name: Moon Ball
MOONBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that evolve using the Moon Stone.

DREAMBALL.name: Dream Ball
DREAMBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon while they're asleep.

BEASTBALL.name: Beast Ball
BEASTBALL.description: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others.

TM01.name: TM01
TM01.description: After making its attack the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

TM02.name: TM02
TM02.description: Rushes on a meteor and strikes the foe. Builds up more power and +Speed.

TM03.name: TM03
TM03.description: The user attacks in decreased priority in exchange for ensuring the attack lands.

TM04.name: TM04
TM04.description: The user utters a spell that inflicts a random status condition on the target

TM05.name: TM05
TM05.description: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its foe. It also damages the user a little.

TM06.name: TM06
TM06.description: If it is the opposite gender of the user the target becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.

TM07.name: TM07
TM07.description: The user attacks the target with great power. However it also lowers the user's Attack and Defense.

TM08.name: TM08
TM08.description: The user shoots a sinister bluish-white flame at the target to inflict a burn.

TM09.name: TM09
TM09.description: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. The user also takes serious damage.

TM10.name: TM10
TM10.description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM11.name: TM11
TM11.description: A two-turn attack. The user gathers light then blasts a bundled beam on the second turn.

TM12.name: TM12
TM12.description: The user lays a trap of spikes at the foe's feet. The trap hurts foes that switch into battle.

TM13.name: TM13
TM13.description: The user bites with cold-infused fangs. It may also make the target flinch or leave it frozen.

TM14.name: TM14
TM14.description: If the target's HP is down to about half, this attack will hit with double the power.

TM15.name: TM15
TM15.description: A full-power attack that grows more powerful the more the user likes its Trainer.

TM16.name: TM16
TM16.description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle or arm seeped with poison. It may also poison the target.

TM17.name: TM17
TM17.description: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the foe. It may also make the target flinch.

TM18.name: TM18
TM18.description: Drowns the enemies in a landslide of minerals. Always lowers Speed.

TM19.name: TM19
TM19.description: Begins a powerful song. Allies can join in the Round with consecutive uses to increase its power.

TM20.name: TM20
TM20.description: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user the greater the damage.

TM21.name: TM21
TM21.description: The user cuts the foe with sharp shells. It may also lower the target's Defense stat.

TM22.name: TM22
TM22.description: The user drains the target's blood. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

TM23.name: TM23
TM23.description: The user attacks by borrowing the power of the moon. This may also raise user's Sp. Atk by one stage

TM24.name: TM24
TM24.description: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.

TM25.name: TM25
TM25.description: The user gives off a devestating glare that intimidates the target. This lowers the target's Attack stat.

TM26.name: TM26
TM26.description: The user bites with electrified fangs. It may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.

TM27.name: TM27
TM27.description: With mischievous intent the user pummels the target, raising the user's Attack stat.

TM28.name: TM28
TM28.description: An energy-draining punch. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

TM29.name: TM29
TM29.description: The user intensifies the sun for five turns powering up Fire-type moves.

TM30.name: TM30
TM30.description: The user nimbly strikes the foe. This attack does more damage if the user is not holding an item.

TM31.name: TM31
TM31.description: Performs an elegant dance that draws power from the dead and boosts its Sp. Atk and Speed stats.

TM32.name: TM32
TM32.description: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status problems affecting the user's party.

TM33.name: TM33
TM33.description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.

TM34.name: TM34
TM34.description: The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. It also lowers the targets' Speed stat.

TM35.name: TM35
TM35.description: The user purges the target of their wrongdoings. Does double damage if the target is statused.

TM36.name: TM36
TM36.description: It enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

TM37.name: TM37
TM37.description: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the foe's feet. They poison foes that switch into battle.

TM38.name: TM38
TM38.description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to suppress damage from physical attacks for five turns.

TM39.name: TM39
TM39.description: Boulders are hurled at the target. It also lowers the target's Speed by preventing its movement.

TM40.name: TM40
TM40.description: Letting out a noble roar the user intimidates the target and lowers its Attack.

TM41.name: TM41
TM41.description: The user fires a highly energetic blast at the target. Chance to lower Sp. Def.

TM42.name: TM42
TM42.description: The user slams into the target using a full-force blast of water. Chance to lower the target's Defense.

TM43.name: TM43
TM43.description: While resisting the opponent the user struggles - the Sp.Atk of all opponents.

TM44.name: TM44
TM44.description: The user hurls itself at the target. It also damages the user by a fairly large amount however.

TM45.name: TM45
TM45.description: The user slaps down the target's held item preventing that item from being used in the battle.

TM46.name: TM46
TM46.description: The user swings its limbs wildly and attacks opposing Pokémon lowering their Attack stats.

TM47.name: TM47
TM47.description: A weak electric charge is launched at the target. It causes paralysis if it hits.

TM48.name: TM48
TM48.description: The user charmingly gazes at the foe making it less wary. The target's Attack is harshly lowered.

TM49.name: TM49
TM49.description: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def.

TM50.name: TM50
TM50.description: The user attacks the foe with fire. The target's held Berry or Gem becomes burnt up and unusable.

TM51.name: TM51
TM51.description: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. It may also make the target flinch.

TM52.name: TM52
TM52.description: This relentless attack does massive damage to a target affected by status problems.

TM53.name: TM53
TM53.description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM54.name: TM54
TM54.description: The user strikes everything around it by stomping on the ground. It reduces hit Pokémon's Speed.

TM55.name: TM55
TM55.description: The user summons a hail storm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except the Ice type.

TM56.name: TM56
TM56.description: The user creates a protective field that prevents status problems for eight turns.

TM57.name: TM57
TM57.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns. It fully restores the user's HP and heals any status problem.

TM58.name: TM58
TM58.description: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.

TM59.name: TM59
TM59.description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to suppress damage from special attacks for five turns.

TM60.name: TM60
TM60.description: Summons a five-turn sandstorm to hurt all combatants except the Rock, Ground and Steel types.

TM61.name: TM61
TM61.description: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with the power to inflict damage.

TM62.name: TM62
TM62.description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. It sharply raises the user's Attack stat.

TM63.name: TM63
TM63.description: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns powering up Water-type moves.

TM64.name: TM64
TM64.description: Fires an exploding pollen puff at enemies or a HP-restoring one at allies.

TM65.name: TM65
TM65.description: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

TM66.name: TM66
TM66.description: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. It may also make the target flinch.

TM67.name: TM67
TM67.description: Produces dragonfire similar to that of a creature belonging in a far-away land. May cause a burn.

TM68.name: TM68
TM68.description: The user fires a concentrated bundle of electricity also raising the user's Sp. Atk stat.

TM69.name: TM69
TM69.description: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target's Attack stat.

TM70.name: TM70
TM70.description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body boosting both its Attack and Defense stats.

TM71.name: TM71
TM71.description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. It may also leave the target with a burn.

TM72.name: TM72
TM72.description: A strong wind blows away the foe's obstacles such as Light Screen. It also lowers their evasion.

TM73.name: TM73
TM73.description: The user possesses the target and eviscerates itself damaging the user susbtantially.

TM74.name: TM74
TM74.description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

TM75.name: TM75
TM75.description: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm for four to five turns.

TM76.name: TM76
TM76.description: The user bites down on the target with a glacial jaw. May -target's Def by 1.

TM77.name: TM77
TM77.description: The user damages foes by blinding them with a powerful flash.

TM78.name: TM78
TM78.description: The user makes a copy of itself using some of its HP. The copy serves as the user's decoy.

TM79.name: TM79
TM79.description: The user bites the target with toxic fangs. It will also leave the target poisoned.

TM80.name: TM80
TM80.description: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

TM81.name: TM81
TM81.description: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the foe. The trap hurts foes that switch into battle.

TM82.name: TM82
TM82.description: The user attacks the foe with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn it does greater damage.

TM83.name: TM83
TM83.description: The foe slams the target with its steel-hard head. It may also make the target flinch.

TM84.name: TM84
TM84.description: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. It may also leave the target with a burn.

TM85.name: TM85
TM85.description: Drinks nectar and restores its own HP by half of its max HP.

TM86.name: TM86
TM86.description: The opposing team is engulfed in a sea of stardust. May lower the target's Sp.Atk.

TM87.name: TM87
TM87.description: The user yells as if it is ranting about something making the target's Sp. Atk stat decrease.

TM88.name: TM88
TM88.description: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. It then becomes confused however.

TM89.name: TM89
TM89.description: A strong electric blast is loosed at the target. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

TM90.name: TM90
TM90.description: The user steals the target's HP with a kiss. The user's HP is restored by over half of the damage dealt.

TM91.name: TM91
TM91.description: Striking opponents repeatedly makes the user's fists harder raising the user's Attack stat.

TM92.name: TM92
TM92.description: The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. It may also make the target flinch or leave it burned.

TM93.name: TM93
TM93.description: A strong wind causes the target to drop their held item.

TM94.name: TM94
TM94.description: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all the other types.

TM95.name: TM95
TM95.description: The user violently whirls its vines or tentacles to harshly lash the target.

TM96.name: TM96
TM96.description: The user makes the ground under the foe erupt with power. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def.

TM97.name: TM97
TM97.description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. It may also freeze the target solid.

TM98.name: TM98
TM98.description: The user weaponizes light and singes the target. It may also leave the target with a burn.

TM99.name: TM99
TM99.description: A restrained attack that prevents the target from fainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.

TM100.name: TM100
TM100.description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. It may also poison the target.

TM101.name: TM101
TM101.description: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. It may also reduce the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM102.name: TM102
TM102.description: Large boulders are hurled at the foes to inflict damage. It may also make the targets flinch.

TM103.name: TM103
TM103.description: The user echoes a deafening sound towards the target. The attack's recoil harshly reduces the user's Atk stat.

TM104.name: TM104
TM104.description: The user fires a projectile towards the target. This attack does physical damage.

TM105.name: TM105
TM105.description: Traps foes in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.

TM106.name: TM106
TM106.description: The user attacks with colourful scales. It may also lower the target's accuracy.

TM107.name: TM107
TM107.description: The user attacks the target with an avatar of cosmic energy. However it also lowers the user's Attack and Defense.

TM108.name: TM108
TM108.description: The user performs a decisive technique that harshly reduces the user's Atk stat.

TM109.name: TM109
TM109.description: The user sheds its skin to heal itself for half of its max HP.

TM110.name: TM110
TM110.description: A corrosive substance is sprayed on the target. It may also poison the target.

TM111.name: TM111
TM111.description: The Queen of fairies appears to smite the foe. It may also raise the user's Sp. Def stat.

TM112.name: TM112
TM112.description: A test of mental strength. SE against Psychic type.

TM113.name: TM113
TM113.description: Rams the target with blazing horns, damaging the user a little.

TM114.name: TM114
TM114.description: Calls a herd of its own species to carry out 2-5 consecutive attacks on the target.

TM115.name: TM115
TM115.description: The user evokes the power of the deceased to strengthen its defenses.

TM116.name: TM116
TM116.description: Protects the user from attacks. Also damages attackers that make contact with the user.

TM117.name: TM117
TM117.description: When the user knocks out a target with this move the user's Sp. Atk stat rises drastically.

TM118.name: TM118
TM118.description: The user cloaks its body with a white mist that prevents any of its stats from being cut for five turns.

TM119.name: TM119
TM119.description: The user projects flashing lights to raise its Sp. Atk and Accuracy by 1 stage.

TM120.name: TM120
TM120.description: Filled with skepticism this move is SE on Ghost-types.

TM121.name: TM121
TM121.description: The user throws a concoction at the target. Deals physical or special damage depending on which will be more effective.

TM122.name: TM122
TM122.description: Drains the mental faculties of the target, restoring half of damage dealt.

TM123.name: TM123
TM123.description: The user catapults itself onto the foe. It has a chance to raise the user's Speed stat.

TM124.name: TM124
TM124.description: The user aims for the target's hearing, lowering its defense by one stage if it hits.

TM125.name: TM125
TM125.description: The user bombards the target with rockets. It may also make the target flinch.

TM126.name: TM126
TM126.description: The user immerses the target in superheated steam. This may also leave the target with a burn.

TM127.name: TM127
TM127.description: Protects grounded Pokémon from priority moves and powers up Psychic-type moves for five turns.

TM128.name: TM128
TM128.description: Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after battle.

TM129.name: TM129
TM129.description: The user replenishes everything anew. High chance of cancelling any Weather.

TM130.name: TM130
TM130.description: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon's held items lose their effects for five turns.

HM01.name: HM01
HM01.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw. This can also be used to cut down thin trees.

HM02.name: HM02
HM02.description: The user soars and then strikes on the next turn. This can also be used to fly to any familiar town.

HM03.name: HM03
HM03.description: Attacks everything by swamping the surroundings with a giant wave. This can also be used to cross water.

HM04.name: HM04
HM04.description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power. This can also be used to move heavy boulders.

HM05.name: HM05
HM05.description: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch. It can also be used to climb a waterfall.

HM06.name: HM06
HM06.description: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and attacks on the second. It can be used to dive underwater.

CHERIBERRY.name: Cheri Berry
CHERIBERRY.description: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from paralysis.

CHESTOBERRY.name: Chesto Berry
CHESTOBERRY.description: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from sleep.

PECHABERRY.name: Pecha Berry
PECHABERRY.description: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from poison.

RAWSTBERRY.name: Rawst Berry
RAWSTBERRY.description: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from a burn.

ASPEARBERRY.name: Aspear Berry
ASPEARBERRY.description: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to defrost it.

LEPPABERRY.name: Leppa Berry
LEPPABERRY.description: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to restore a move's PP by 10.

ENIGMABERRY.name: Enigma Berry

CUSTAPBERRY.name: Custap Berry

JABOCABERRY.name: Jaboca Berry

ROWAPBERRY.name: Rowap Berry
ROWAPBERRY.description: If held by a Pokémon and a special attack lands, the attacker also takes damage.

KEEBERRY.name: Kee Berry
KEEBERRY.description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the holder's Defense if it's hit with a physical move.

MARANGABERRY.name: Maranga Berry
MARANGABERRY.description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the holder's Sp. Def if it's hit with a special move.

GRASSMAIL.name: Grass Mail
GRASSMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of a refreshingly green field. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

FLAMEMAIL.name: Flame Mail
FLAMEMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of flames in blazing red. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

BUBBLEMAIL.name: Bubble Mail
BUBBLEMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of a blue world underwater. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

BLOOMMAIL.name: Bloom Mail
BLOOMMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of pretty floral patterns. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

TUNNELMAIL.name: Tunnel Mail
TUNNELMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of a dimly lit coal mine. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

STEELMAIL.name: Steel Mail
STEELMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of cool mechanical designs. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

HEARTMAIL.name: Heart Mail
HEARTMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of giant heart patterns. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

SNOWMAIL.name: Snow Mail

SPACEMAIL.name: Space Mail
SPACEMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print depicting the huge expanse of space. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

AIRMAIL.name: Air Mail
AIRMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of colorful letter sets. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

MOSAICMAIL.name: Mosaic Mail
MOSAICMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of a vivid rainbow pattern. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

BRICKMAIL.name: Brick Mail
BRICKMAIL.description: Stationery featuring a print of a tough-looking brick pattern. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

XATTACK2.name: X Attack 2
XATTACK2.description: It sharply raises the Attack stat of a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

XATTACK3.name: X Attack 3
XATTACK3.description: It drastically raises the Attack stat of a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

XATTACK6.name: X Attack 6

XSPDEF6.name: X Sp. Def 6

XSPEED3.description: It drastically raises the Speed stat of a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

XSPEED6.name: X Speed 6

XACCURACY6.name: X Accuracy 6

MAXMUSHROOMS.name: Max Mushrooms
MAXMUSHROOMS.description: Mushrooms that boost all stats of a Pokémon during battle.

DIREHIT.name: Dire Hit
DIREHIT.description: An item that raises the critical-hit ratio by 1 stage. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

DIREHIT2.name: Dire Hit 2
DIREHIT2.description: It sharply raises the critical-hit ratio. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

DIREHIT3.name: Dire Hit 3
DIREHIT3.description: It dramatically raises the critical-hit ratio. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

GUARDSPEC.name: Guard Spec.
GUARDSPEC.description: An item that prevents stat reduction among the Trainer's party Pokémon for five turns after use.

RESETURGE.name: Reset Urge
RESETURGE.description: When used, it restores any stat changes of an ally Pokémon.

ABILITYURGE.name: Ability Urge
ABILITYURGE.description: When used, it activates the Ability of an ally Pokémon.

ITEMURGE.name: Item Urge
ITEMURGE.description: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to use its held item.

ITEMDROP.name: Item Drop
ITEMDROP.description: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to drop a held item.

BLUEFLUTE.name: Blue Flute
BLUEFLUTE.description: A blue flute made from blown glass. Its melody awakens a single Pokémon from sleep.

YELLOWFLUTE.name: Yellow Flute
YELLOWFLUTE.description: A yellow flute made from blown glass. Its melody snaps a single Pokémon out of confusion.

REDFLUTE.name: Red Flute
REDFLUTE.description: A red flute made from blown glass. Its melody snaps a single Pokémon out of infatuation.

POKEDOLL.name: Poké Doll
POKEDOLL.description: A doll that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

FLUFFYTAIL.name: Fluffy Tail
FLUFFYTAIL.description: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

POKETOY.name: Poké Toy
POKETOY.description: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

BICYCLE.name: Bicycle
BICYCLE.description: A folding Bicycle that enables much faster movement than the Running Shoes.

OLDROD.name: Old Rod
OLDROD.description: An old and beat-up fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

GOODROD.name: Good Rod
GOODROD.description: A new, good-quality fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

SUPERROD.name: Super Rod
SUPERROD.description: An awesome, high-tech fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

ITEMFINDER.name: Itemfinder
ITEMFINDER.description: A device used for finding items. If there is a hidden item nearby when it is used, it emits a signal.

DOWSINGMACHINE.name: Dowsing Machine
DOWSINGMACHINE.description: It checks for unseen items in the area and makes noise and lights when it finds something.

POKERADAR.name: Poké Radar
POKERADAR.description: A tool that can search out Pokémon that are hiding in grass. Its battery is recharged as you walk.

TOWNMAP.name: Town Map
TOWNMAP.description: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime. It even shows your present location.

ESCAPEROPE.name: Escape Rope
ESCAPEROPE.description: A long, durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

COINCASE.name: Coin Case
COINCASE.description: A case for holding coins obtained at the Game Corner. It holds up to 99,999 coins.

POKEFLUTE.name: Poké Flute
POKEFLUTE.description: A flute that is said to instantly awaken any Pokémon. It has a lovely tone.

SOOTSACK.name: Soot Sack
SOOTSACK.description: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

SILPHSCOPE.name: Silph Scope
SILPHSCOPE.description: A scope that makes unseeable Pokémon visible. It is made by Silph Co.

DEVONSCOPE.name: Devon Scope
DEVONSCOPE.description: A device by Devon that signals any unseeable Pokémon.

SQUIRTBOTTLE.name: Squirt Bottle
SQUIRTBOTTLE.description: A watering can shaped like a Squirtle. It helps promote healthy growth of Berries planted in soft soil.

SPRAYDUCK.name: Sprayduck
SPRAYDUCK.description: A watering can shaped like a Psyduck. It helps promote healthy growth of Berries planted in soft soil.

WAILMERPAIL.name: Wailmer Pail
WAILMERPAIL.description: A nifty watering pail. Use it to promote strong growth in Berries planted in soft soil.

SPRINKLOTAD.name: Sprinklotad
SPRINKLOTAD.description: A watering can shaped like a Lotad. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in soft soil.

GRACIDEA.name: Gracidea
GRACIDEA.description: A flower sometimes bundled in bouquets to convey gratitude on special occasions like birthdays.

REVEALGLASS.name: Reveal Glass
REVEALGLASS.description: A glass that reveals the truth. It is a mysterious glass that returns a Pokémon back to its original shape.

PRISONBOTTLE.name: Prison Bottle
PRISONBOTTLE.description: A bottle believed to have been used to seal away the power of a certain Pokémon long, long ago.

ROTOMCATALOG.name: Rotom Catalog
ROTOMCATALOG.description: A catalog of devices that Rotom like. Use the catalog to have Rotom hop in and out of the devices listed within.

ZYGARDECUBE.name: Zygarde Cube
ZYGARDECUBE.description: An item in which Zygarde Cores and Cells are gathered. You can also use it to change Zygarde's forms.

DNASPLICERS.name: DNA Splicers
DNASPLICERS.description: A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a certain Pokémon. They are said to have been one in the beginning.

DNASPLICERSUSED.name: DNA Splicers
DNASPLICERSUSED.description: A splicer that separates Kyurem and a certain Pokémon when they have been fused.

NSOLARIZER.name: N-Solarizer
NSOLARIZER.description: A machine to fuse Necrozma, which needs light, and Solgaleo.

NSOLARIZERUSED.name: N-Solarizer
NSOLARIZERUSED.description: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Solgaleo.

NLUNARIZER.name: N-Lunarizer
NLUNARIZER.description: A machine to fuse Necrozma, which needs light, and Lunala.

NLUNARIZERUSED.name: N-Lunarizer
NLUNARIZERUSED.description: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Lunala.

REINSOFUNITY.name: Reins of Unity
REINSOFUNITY.description: Reins that people presented to the king. They unite Calyrex with its beloved steed.

REINSOFUNITYUSED.name: Reins of Unity
REINSOFUNITYUSED.description: Reins that people presented to the king. They separate Calyrex and its beloved steed.

OVALCHARM.name: Oval Charm
OVALCHARM.description: An oval charm said to increase the chance of Eggs being found at the Day Care.

SHINYCHARM.name: Shiny Charm
SHINYCHARM.description: A shiny charm said to increase the chance of finding a Shiny Pokémon.

CATCHINGCHARM.name: Catching Charm
CATCHINGCHARM.description: A charm said to increase the chance of getting a critical catch. The charm doesn't shake much.

EXPCHARM.name: Exp. Charm
EXPCHARM.description: A charm that increases the Exp. Points that Pokémon can get. A machine-like object is inside it.

MEGARING.name: Mega Ring
MEGARING.description: This ring contains an untold power that somehow enables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to Mega Evolve.

POKEMONBOXLINK.name: Pokémon Box Link
POKEMONBOXLINK.description: A device that allows you to access the Pokémon storage system. There are some places where it won't work.

AURORATICKET.name: Aurora Ticket
AURORATICKET.description: A ticket required to board the ship to Doxy Island. It glows beautifully.

OLDSEAMAP.name: Old Sea Map
OLDSEAMAP.description: A faded sea chart that shows the way to a certain island.

REDSCARF.name: Red Scarf
REDSCARF.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the Cool aspect of the holder in a Contest.

BLUESCARF.name: Blue Scarf
BLUESCARF.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the Beauty aspect of the holder in a Contest.

PINKSCARF.name: Pink Scarf
PINKSCARF.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the Cute aspect of the holder in a Contest.

GREENSCARF.name: Green Scarf
GREENSCARF.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the Smart aspect of the holder in a Contest.

YELLOWSCARF.name: Yellow Scarf
YELLOWSCARF.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the Tough aspect of the holder in a Contest.

TM00.name: TM00
TM00.description: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.

BOTTLECAP.name: Bottle Cap
BOTTLECAP.description: A beautiful bottle cap that gives off a silver gleam. Some people are happy to receive one.

GOLDBOTTLECAP.name: Gold Bottle Cap
GOLDBOTTLECAP.description: A beautiful bottle cap that gives off a golden gleam. Some people are happy to receive one.

MELTANCANDY.name: Meltan Candy
MELTANCANDY.description: A candy that is packed with energy. Feeding it to a certain Pokémon will make it evolve.

INFINITEROPE.name: Infinite Rope
INFINITEROPE.description: A long, durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

TR00.name: TR00
TR00.description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user's Attack stat.

TR01.name: TR01
TR01.description: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

TR02.name: TR02
TR02.description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

TR03.name: TR03
TR03.description: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.

TR04.name: TR04
TR04.description: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.

TR05.name: TR05
TR05.description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.

TR06.name: TR06
TR06.description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike the opposing team. It may also freeze them solid.

TR07.name: TR07
TR07.description: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over. It inflicts greater damage on heavier targets.

TR08.name: TR08
TR08.description: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

TR09.name: TR09
TR09.description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

TR10.name: TR10
TR10.description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.

TR11.name: TR11
TR11.description: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also leave the target confused.

TR12.name: TR12
TR12.description: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.

TR13.name: TR13
TR13.description: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.

TR14.name: TR14
TR14.description: The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain into randomly using nearly any move.

TR15.name: TR15
TR15.description: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

TR16.name: TR16
TR16.description: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.

TR17.name: TR17
TR17.description: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. This sharply raises the user's Sp. Def stat.

TR18.name: TR18
TR18.description: The user drains the target's blood. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

TR19.name: TR19
TR19.description: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. This may also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.

TR20.name: TR20
TR20.description: The user creates a substitute for itself using some of its HP. The substitute serves as the user's decoy.

TR21.name: TR21
TR21.description: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.

TR22.name: TR22
TR22.description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.

TR23.name: TR23
TR23.description: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team's feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.

TR24.name: TR24
TR24.description: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.

TR25.name: TR25
TR25.description: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.

TR26.name: TR26
TR26.description: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

TR27.name: TR27
TR27.description: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the moves it knows.

TR28.name: TR28
TR28.description: Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams into the target with no letup.

TR29.name: TR29
TR29.description: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.

TR30.name: TR30
TR30.description: The user compels the target to keep using the move it encored for three turns.

TR31.name: TR31
TR31.description: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

TR32.name: TR32
TR32.description: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

TR33.name: TR33
TR33.description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TR34.name: TR34
TR34.description: Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic energy attacks the target.

TR35.name: TR35
TR35.description: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.

TR36.name: TR36
TR36.description: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with a burn.

TR37.name: TR37
TR37.description: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.

TR38.name: TR38
TR38.description: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.

TR39.name: TR39
TR39.description: The user attacks the target with great power. However, this also lowers the user's Attack and Defense.

TR40.name: TR40
TR40.description: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.

TR41.name: TR41
TR41.description: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit more easily. This may also leave the target with a burn.

TR42.name: TR42
TR42.description: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with the power to inflict damage.

TR43.name: TR43
TR43.description: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack's recoil harshly lowers the user's Sp. Atk stat.

TR44.name: TR44
TR44.description: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

TR45.name: TR45
TR45.description: The user launches a hard-packed mud ball to attack. This may also lower the target's accuracy.

TR46.name: TR46
TR46.description: The user hardens its body's surface like iron, sharply raising its Defense stat.

TR47.name: TR47
TR47.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

TR48.name: TR48
TR48.description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.

TR49.name: TR49
TR49.description: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

TR50.name: TR50
TR50.description: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and attacks by cutting its target. Critical hits land more easily.

TR51.name: TR51
TR51.description: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that raises its Attack and Speed stats.

TR52.name: TR52
TR52.description: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user, the greater the damage.

TR53.name: TR53
TR53.description: The user fights the foe up close without guarding itself. It also cuts the user's Defense and Sp. Def.

TR54.name: TR54
TR54.description: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the opponent's feet. They poison opponents that switch into battle.

TR55.name: TR55
TR55.description: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the foe. The user sustains serious damage, too.

TR56.name: TR56
TR56.description: The user looses a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses.

TR57.name: TR57
TR57.description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.

TR58.name: TR58
TR58.description: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. This may also make the target flinch.

TR59.name: TR59
TR59.description: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.

TR60.name: TR60
TR60.description: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.

TR61.name: TR61
TR61.description: The user generates a damaging sound wave by vibration. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TR62.name: TR62
TR62.description: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user's gaping mouth.

TR63.name: TR63
TR63.description: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.

TR64.name: TR64
TR64.description: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TR65.name: TR65
TR65.description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TR66.name: TR66
TR66.description: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. This also damages the user quite a lot.

TR67.name: TR67
TR67.description: The user makes the ground under the foe erupt with power. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def.

TR68.name: TR68
TR68.description: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user's Sp. Atk stat.

TR69.name: TR69
TR69.description: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.

TR70.name: TR70
TR70.description: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it all at once. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TR71.name: TR71
TR71.description: A storm of sharp leaves is whipped up. The attack's recoil sharply reduces the user's Sp. Atk stat.

TR72.name: TR72
TR72.description: The user violently whirls its vines, tentacles, or the like to harshly lash the target.

TR73.name: TR73
TR73.description: The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to attack. This may also poison the target.

TR74.name: TR74
TR74.description: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head. This may also make the target flinch.

TR75.name: TR75
TR75.description: The user stabs the target from below with sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.

TR76.name: TR76
TR76.description: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the foe. The trap hurts foes that switch into battle.

TR77.name: TR77
TR77.description: The user snares the target with grass and trips it. The heavier the target, the greater the damage.

TR78.name: TR78
TR78.description: It swamps the area around the user with a giant sludge wave. It may also poison those hit.

TR79.name: TR79
TR79.description: The user slams with its heavy body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move's power.

TR80.name: TR80
TR80.description: The user hurls an electric orb. The faster the user is than the foe, the greater the move's power.

TR81.name: TR81
TR81.description: The user turns the foe's power against it. The higher the foe's Attack stat, the greater the damage.

TR82.name: TR82
TR82.description: The user attacks with stored power. The more the user's stats are raised, the greater the move's power.

TR83.name: TR83
TR83.description: The user teleports using a strange power and switches places with one of its allies.

TR84.name: TR84
TR84.description: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. This may also leave the target with a burn.

TR85.name: TR85
TR85.description: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.

TR86.name: TR86
TR86.description: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its foe. This also damages the user a little.

TR87.name: TR87
TR87.description: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.

TR88.name: TR88
TR88.description: The user slams with its flaming body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move's power.

TR89.name: TR89
TR89.description: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a fierce wind. This may also confuse the target.

TR90.name: TR90
TR90.description: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target's Attack stat.

TR91.name: TR91
TR91.description: Opponents are covered in odd poison goo. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.

TR92.name: TR92
TR92.description: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.

TR93.name: TR93
TR93.description: The user swings both arms and hits the foe. The foe's stat changes don't affect this attack's damage.

TR94.name: TR94
TR94.description: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.

TR95.name: TR95
TR95.description: The user attacks the target's throat, which prevents it from using moves that emit sound for two turns.

TR96.name: TR96
TR96.description: The user attacks with an exploding pollen puff. If the target is an ally, it restores its HP instead.

TR97.name: TR97
TR97.description: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.

TR98.name: TR98
TR98.description: The user slams into the target using a full-force blast of water. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

TR99.name: TR99
TR99.description: The user attacks by slamming its body into the target. The higher the user's Defense, the more damage it inflicts.

INTELLECTVIAL.name: Intellect Vial
INTELLECTVIAL.description: It raises the SpAtk and SpDef stat of a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

PROTECTIONVIAL.name: Protection Vial
